treatment.description: Leaf blades mostly 8–20 cm × 5–20 (–25) mm. Phyllaries: bases ± rounded, apices acuminate or attenuate to linear or filiform. Ray laminae 15–50 mm. Cypselae 7–9 mm; pappi 0.01–0.5 mm. 2n = 38 (subspp. unknown).
treatment.discussion: The subspecies of Scabrethia scabra evidently have evolved along with the dissection of the Colorado Plateau.

key_statement.statement: Outer phyllaries: chartaceous bases ovate to oblong, 2–4(–6) mm, herbaceous tips attenuate to linear or filiform, 15–30+ mm, margins ± hispid (ciliate), faces glabrous or minutely gland-dotted

Outer phyllaries: chartaceous bases deltate to ovate, 2–5+ mm, herbaceous tips narrowly triangular to attenuate, 10–20 mm, margins (ciliolate or not) and faces minutely hispidulous to hirtellous or ± coarsely hispid.
Herbaceous tips of outer phyllaries usually spreading to recurved, margins (not ciliate) and faces minutely hispidulous to hirtellous
Herbaceous tips of outer phyllaries usually ± erect to spreading, margins (± ciliate) and faces ± coarsely hispid
